name: Pumpkin Cookie Dough Bread
description: Sweet Pumpkin Bread with Cookie Dough Layers
ingredients: 1/3 cup melted coconut oil (or melted butter or olive oil)
1/2 cup chocolate chips or chocolate chunks
1 cup raw cookie dough (store-bought edible cookie dough or homemade edible dough)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a 9x5-inch loaf pan with parchment paper, leaving some overhang for easy lifting
In a large bowl, whisk together the pumpkin purée, eggs, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract until smooth
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, pumpkin pie spice, and cinnamon
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir gently until just combined
Fold in the brown sugar and chocolate chips
Pour 1/3 of the batter into the loaf pan and smooth it out
Crumble or spread 1/2 of the cookie dough over the batter
Add the next 1/3 of the batter, then the remaining cookie dough
Finish with the final 1/3 of batter on top
Bake for 55–65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out mostly clean (a few moist crumbs are okay)
Let the bread cool in the pan for 30 minutes, then lift out and cool completely before slicing
